Params: {1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory673.jpg'}
{3: '"Simulation complete. No match found based on search filters. Addition of new parameters is recommended."'}
{3: '"Would you like to save current search filters?"'}
{3: '"Simulation history cleared. You may exit now, ma\'am."'}

{1: '1', 3: "The pod's door opens, showing a white-haired girl who's disconnecting all the data transfer cables from herself. Then, she stumbles out of the pod, having yet to regain her sense of balance."}
{3: 'Babylonia\'s "QRF"... Vera, Lee, Ayla, Karenina... and Commandant...'}
{3: 'Dulcinea separates their shared memories and enters them in order into this gigantic "prediction" machine for simulation.'}

{3: 'Dulcinea always finds herself momentarily lost between reality and virtuality every time a simulation like this is run, and it always takes her a considerable amount of time to re-acclimate after a simulation.'}
{3: 'This time, she went through four rounds of simulation in a row.'}
{3: '"Ma\'am, it appears that you have been affected to a significant extent by the simulations. Would you like to re-acclimate before the next simulation?"'}
{3: "Affected to a significant extent? By the simulations? Always a bystander throughout the simulations, Dulcinea can't even begin to imagine what's affected her..."}
{3: 'But whatever that might be, it seems almost insignificant compared to what Constellia is up against at the moment...'}
{2: 'Dulcinea', 3: 'What time is it?', 4: '1'}
{3: '"It\'s 9:30 PM; the third day into the Palette Clash."'}
{2: 'Dulcinea', 3: 'Calibration complete.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Dulcinea', 3: 'Load saved simulation history.', 4: '1'}
{3: '"Loading complete. No match found for simulations with the four Constructs in question."'}
{2: 'Dulcinea', 3: 'Seems like the Palette Clash is bound to have some adverse effects on Constellia...', 4: '1'}
{3: '"No match found."'}
{3: "The inorganic voice of the system that fills the room serves to remind Dulcinea that no one is going to answer her question, since she's no longer in a simulation."}
{2: 'Dulcinea', 3: 'Clear loaded simulation history.', 4: '1'}
{3: '"History cleared."'}
{3: 'And with that, the system falls silent—without so much as asking a single question or poking fun at Dulcinea.'}
{2: 'Dulcinea', 3: "I'm sure Master has a good reason for keeping this machine, and I believe this machine holds the answer to Constellia's future.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Dulcinea', 3: 'Reload memory and reset search filters...', 4: '1'}

{3: 'After entering into the machine the memories she shares with the humans and Constructs, Dulcinea simulates every single one of the memories—until she sees what appears to be the best solution...'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/Bgstory101.png'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Vera', 3: 'Is that so? Well, go on, then.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Vera', 3: 'Go on and party all you want. For all you care, this city that humans and machines built together can burn and rot.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Vera', 3: 'Paranoia is a beast—especially when it comes at you unnoticed.', 4: '1'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory673.jpg'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Dulcinea', 3: "Vera was right. We're out of time...", 4: '1'}
{3: 'Dulcinea steps out of the sleeping pod.'}
{3: 'Time never stops when she tries to get close to humanity in search of an answer through all her simulations.'}
{3: "Feeling uneasy at first, Dulcinea now finds herself wanting to learn more about humanity—although symbiosis has been humanity's choice thus far."}
{3: 'Humanity, however, finds itself torn into different fractions, as Teddy has pointed out, and there is no telling how things are going to unfold moving forward.'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory667.jpg'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Ayla', 3: 'I want to try to believe them, Commandant, because they have souls, too...', 4: '1'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory673.jpg'}
{3: 'Dulcinea wonders if she, too, should give humanity the benefit of the doubt and try to look for an answer by interacting with them directly...'}
{3: "Right then, a halo that seems to be an assemblage of data materializes over Dulcinea's head."}
{3: '"Your admin privilege has been verified. Welcome, ma\'am."'}
{2: 'Dulcinea', 3: "Connect to Constellia's city network and contact these people for me...", 4: '2'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/Bgstory101.png'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Karenina', 3: "What's the matter?", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Teddy', 3: "I think we have an issue here with the visual sensors we put in the city. The footage that came back doesn't match the area we were keeping tabs on.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Teddy', 3: "See, this sensor is supposed to go from right to left, but it's almost pointing at the sky now.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Karenina', 3: 'The work of some slacker, I presume?', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Teddy', 3: "I don't think it has to do with the sensor itself. Let me look into the coding.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Karenina', 3: 'Found anything?', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Teddy', 3: 'Someone found their way in without setting off a single alarm.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Teddy', 3: "And it doesn't look like someone from Babylonia... Seems like they came in through Constellia's city network.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Karenina', 3: 'What are they trying to do?', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Teddy', 3: 'They seem to be who we were looking for with the visual sensors, though, judging from the traces they left behind. Let me try to build a target model of them.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Karenina', 3: "Wait, isn't that...", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Teddy', 3: "Right, that's the Gray Raven Commandant...", 4: '1'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory0.png'}
{1: '999', 2: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory66.jpg', 3: '0', 4: '1', 5: '1'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory66.jpg'}
{3: 'The world around you goes from dark to bright and, before you know it, back to dark again—when the gunny sack is yanked away from your head.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Dulcinea', 3: 'Apologies, Commandant. I really wish we could have met under better circumstances.', 4: '1'}
{3: "You recognize the voice but can't quite match it to a face—and it's when your eyes have grown used to the light that you finally start to make out the Construct standing in front of you."}
{3: 'Wait, a Construct?'}
{2: '???', 3: 'Nice to meet you, Gray Raven Commandant...', 4: '2'}
{3: "The Construct sounds and seems friendly enough, except you still don't understand why you were brought here."}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Effect/Prefab/FxUi/FxUiStoryNew/FxUiStoryWhiteNew.prefab', 2: '3'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory670.jpg'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Dulcinea', 3: 'Shh... quiet now.', 4: '1'}
{3: "The world around you turns pitch black again. You try to protest, but it doesn't stop your abductors from patting you down from head to toe."}
{3: "They even take away the signal launcher that you've been keeping handy with you ever since that one time you were taken hostage from the Nighter."}
{3: "But then again, with a Babylonian Construct around, you aren't entirely surprised that they had no trouble figuring out where you kept the signal launcher."}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Effect/Prefab/FxUi/FxUiStoryNew/FxUiStoryWhiteNew.prefab', 2: '3'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory66.jpg'}
{2: 'Who are you? Where am I? What are you trying to do to me?', 3: '119'}
{2: '???', 3: "Well... you probably want to pull yourself together first, Commandant, if you don't want that look on your face to go on tape.", 4: '2'}
{3: "Right, like that's totally going to help... And it doesn't seem like anyone is about to start explaining the situation to me."}
{2: '???', 3: "I wasn't going to let you get your way if I didn't recognize your voice back then... That's what you were going to say, right? Dulcy?", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Dulcinea', 3: "Alisa isn't an enemy, Commandant—or not yet, at least. She was only dealing with the Palette Clash like I'd asked her to.", 4: '1'}
{3: "Abduction of a commandant is a felony that no doubt will be judged at the court-martial—and that's how you know that you probably seem anything but jubilant at the moment."}
{2: 'Are you... a defector?', 3: '128'}
{2: 'Alisa', 3: "Well, that's anyone's guess now, Commandant.", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Alisa', 3: 'But if you work with Dulcy here, not only will you be able to take care of the situation at Constellia, but you just might be able to find the answers you want, too.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Give me everything you took from me.', 3: '132'}
{2: "You didn't really think I was going to swallow that deal just now, did you?", 3: '133'}
{3: 'To your surprise, however, the purple-haired Construct returns your belongings to you as told.'}
{3: "You go through your belongings and see that everything is exactly as you last saw it. It doesn't seem like they're trying to force the deal down your throat here."}
{2: 'Dulcinea', 3: 'Commandant, would you happen to still remember what Vera said before?', 4: '1'}
{3: "Dulcinea is presumably referring to Vera's warning about awakened machines. It seems like she's concerned that Babylonia might change its course of action in light of the warning."}
{2: "If you're worried about the Parliament's decision, then I'm afraid you're underestimating us.", 3: '138'}

{2: 'Alisa', 3: 'But resentment can mount entirely unnoticed. Now, Babylonia might have thought it made a smart move when its Diplomatic Court came up with the plan to build a glass castle with the machines...', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Alisa', 3: "But that's not going to stop resentment from mounting—and the longer it drags on, the stronger all the pent-up emotions are going to be.", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Alisa', 3: "Not to mention that most of the people who will be living with the awakened machines down the road aren't even part of this movement.", 4: '2'}
{3: "Alisa's opinion is the same as some of those who object to the movement. At the end of the day, it really just boils down to what one really wants out of it."}
{2: "So you're suggesting...", 3: '145'}
{2: 'Dulcinea', 3: "We're suggesting that we put an end to the Palette Clash by dawn.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'And how, if I might ask?', 3: '148'}
{3: 'Dulcinea opens her hand to reveal the hologram of a key.'}
{2: 'Dulcinea', 3: "What I'm holding right here in my hand is Constellia's admin privilege.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Alisa', 3: "...Hey, don't look at me like that. I'm just a hired gun for whatever she wants done.", 4: '2'}
{2: "So I'm guessing you'll be the one putting the meat on the bones, Dulcinea?", 3: '152'}
{3: "Both Dulcinea and Alisa look at you as though the question is the stupidest thing they've ever heard."}
{2: 'Alisa', 3: "Not exactly a smart apple, I see—but since you agreed to be part of this, we'll see how we can put you to proper use, Commandant.", 4: '2'}
